# NVIDIA Corporation (NVDA) Q2 FY2026 earnings call transcript

[Powered by Quartr](https://quartr.com/products/quartr-api) Aug 27, 2025, 5:00 PM EDT

NVIDIA reported Q2 FY26 revenue of $46.7B, up significantly YoY, with data center revenue growing 56% YoY despite a $4B decline in H20 revenue. Gross margin reached 72.7% non-GAAP. Q3 revenue is guided to $54B (+16% QoQ), excluding any H20 shipments to China. Blackwell and networking strength are driving growth, with Rubin on track for 2026.

# NVIDIA Announces Financial Results for Second Quarter Fiscal 2026
* Revenue of $46.7 billion, up 6% from Q1 and up 56% from a year ago

* Blackwell Data Center revenue grew 17% sequentially
August 27, 2025

metadata.title: What will be NVIDIA's forward guidance in their Q3 FY2026 earnings release? (GAAP Operating Expenses)
metadata.description:
Guidance is one of the most actionable disclosures a company provides: it shapes Wall Street analyst models, influences buy/sell decisions, and can move entire sectors.

NVIDIA’s forward earnings guidance is a key signal for investors and analysts, reflecting management’s expectations of market demand, supply conditions, and company strategy for the coming quarter. For Q2 FY2026, NVIDIA announced in its [Q1 FY2026 press release (dated May 22, 2025)](https://nvidianews.nvidia.com/news/nvidia-announces-financial-results-for-first-quarter-fiscal-2026):

> NVIDIA’s outlook for the second quarter of fiscal 2026 is as follows:

> Revenue is expected to be \$45.0 billion, plus or minus 2%. This outlook reflects a loss in H20 revenue of approximately \$8.0 billion due to the recent export control limitations.

> GAAP and non-GAAP gross margins are expected to be 71.8% and 72.0%, respectively, plus or minus 50 basis points. The company is continuing to work toward achieving gross margins in the mid-70% range late this year.

> GAAP and non-GAAP operating expenses are expected to be approximately \$5.7 billion and \$4.0 billion, respectively. Full year fiscal 2026 operating expense growth is expected to be in the mid-30% range.

NVIDIA’s forward-looking guidance is a central focus for investors, analysts, and business leaders, as it encapsulates management’s expectations on demand, supply, costs, and market conditions. Revenue, margin, and capex forecasts influence market valuations, investment decisions, and even competitor behavior.

`{"format":"metac_reveal_and_close_in_period","info":{"post_id":40566,"question_id":40140}}`
metadata.resolution_criteria:
This question is a subquestion of a group question. This subquestion specifically targets the option 'GAAP Operating Expenses'. The resolution criteria for the parent question is below. 

This question will resolve as the midpoint of the guidance range for Q4 FY2026 as stated in NVIDIA’s “Outlook” section of its Q3 FY2026 earnings press release, expected to be published on [NVIDIA’s investor relations site](https://nvidianews.nvidia.com/) and the [SEC’s EDGAR system](https://www.sec.gov/) on November 19, 2025.
metadata.fine_print:
* If a single figure (not a range) is provided, that figure will be used.
* If multiple ranges or scenarios are presented, the primary range specified in the official “Outlook” or “Guidance” section will be used to resolve the subquestions.
* If NVIDIA does not issue guidance for Q4 FY2026 in the Q3 FY2026 release, the corresponding subquestion will be **annulled**.
* Only the originally published figure will be used; subsequent updates, corrections, or guidance revisions will be ignored.
